comment.author: 9847519@N08
comment._content: He was the son of Alexander Emmanuel Rodolphe Agassiz (1835 - 1910), a scientist and President of the Calumet and Hecla Mining Company, headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts with mining operations based in Calumet, Michigan, and his beloved wife, the former Anna Russell ( 1840 - 1873).

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an entry in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rudolph_L._Agassiz

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: This isn't the International Polo Cup. Agassiz was only in the 1902 game. This game has: H.H. Harrison J.C. Phipps en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rodolphe_Louis_Agassiz It most likely was an elimination match to determine who would be on the United States team.
